a.title: Harmony Parent Access Information and Help
a.span: Harmony Parent Access Information and Help

li.a: Harmony Parent Access Information and Help

div.h2:
Welcome to North Central Parke Schools
Welcome to the North Central Parke Community School Corporation website. North Central Parke, or NCP, is made up of four schools including Parke Heritage High School, Parke Heritage Middle School, Turkey Run Elementary and Rockville Elementary. Our history is one of building strong character through academic and extracurricular activities. We maintain high expectations for students and strive to guide them to successful outcomes by fostering critical thinking skills and the development of problem solving abilities. Our educators work diligently toward success for all students. If you have questions about any of our programs or would like to explore becoming a part of the NCP Family contact us and we will be happy to help. Sincerely,
Mike Schimpf
Superintendent North Central Parke
765-597-2750
schimpfm@ncp.k12.in.us

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 6px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;

img.title: school year update
img.br:
April 15, 2020
In order to maintain a level of consistency through the COVID-19 Pandemic, North Central Parke Community School Corporation will continue with our three day a week eLearning on Tuesday through Thursday until the end of the school year. The announcement from Governor Holcomb last week to keep schools closed for in-person instruction for the 2019-2020 school year allows us to finish the year upon completion of 160 instructional days. Consequently, NCPSC will conclude our academic portion of the school year on May 19, 2020. Mondays and Fridays will continue to be waiver days.

div.style: display: inline; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(28, 30, 33); font-size: 14px;
div.p: Parents are encouraged to continue to communicate with teachers. Teachers are focusing on instruction and student well-being throughout this unprecedented situation. Students should continue to work diligently toward completion of work and progress toward mastering standards addressed in the activities provided by teachers.
Principals will continue to provide updates on topics relevant to their buildings and culminating activities for the school year.
If you are experiencing technology issues, please be sure to reach out so that we can attempt to help however possible.
Grab and Go lunches will continue on Mondays from 11:00 until 12:00 at Turkey Run Elementary and Rockville Elementary until further notice.
At this time, we do not have a date as to when students would be able to return to the building for personal items in lockers or classrooms. When we have that information, it will be made available.

This is a challenging time for all of us. Some of the best advice that I have received is to be grateful for what we have, to be patient and flexible with one another, and to continue to work at personal improvement. We will get through this. I hope you and your family are well and thank you for your understanding through this challenging season.

Superintendent Mike Schimpf
NCP Continuous Learning Plan Spring 2020
